snippet: A group wants to bring a business improvement district to Corona and Jackson Heights in Queens. Some residents fear it would be costly and rob the area of its character.
abstract: Jackson Heights-Corona Partnership wants to bring  business improvement district to nearly two-mile stretch of Roosevelt Avenue connecting Corona and Jackson Heights in Queens; plan has divided community, with some fearing that it would drain avenue of modest businesses that have afforded many immigrants an economic toehold and provide affordable shopping for area residents.
lead_paragraph: A group wants to bring a business improvement district to Corona and Jackson Heights in Queens. Some residents fear it would be costly and rob the area of its character.

headline.main: In Queens, Balking at Change, Even if It’s Called Improvement
headline.print_headline: In Queens, Balking at Change, Even if It’s Called Improvement
